results.title: White zombie
results.creator_credit: Victor Halperin and Edward C. Halperin
results.brief_description: In this eerie, theatrically staged horror film, a young couple, Madeleine Short (Madge Bellamy) and Neil Parker (John Harron) encounter the world of voodoo and zombies in the Haitian mountains when they arrive as guests of Charles Beaumont (Robert Fraser). When their host enlists the evil powers of Muder Legende (Bela Lugosi) to place a curse on Madeleine, a series of chilling events occur.

results.title: This is spinal tap
results.creator_credit: Rob Reiner, Karen Murphy and Embassy Pictures Corporation (US)
results.brief_description: Filmed as a documentary, this satire mimics a serious rock documentary with interviews, concert footage and glimpses of the day to day life of “Spinal Tap”. Christopher Guest, Michael McKean and Harry Shearer star as the band’s members, while Rob Reiner appears as the film maker (Marty Di Bergi). C0-starring Anjelica Huston and Billy Crystal.

results.title: Mildred Pierce
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, Jerry Wald and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: Joan Crawford earned an Academy Award for her portrayal of Mildred Pierce, a mother who devotes her whole life to her two daughters. When Mildred’s husband turns to another woman for solace, she divorces him and opens a successful restaurant, however, when their eldest daughter’s selfishness gets out of hand, both mother and daughter must face the tragic consequences. Also stars Eve Arden, Ann Blyth, Jack Carson and Zachary Scott.

results.title: New York stories
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Francis Ford Coppola, Martin Scorsese, Robert Greenhut, Fred Fuchs, Fred Roos, Charles H. Joffe, Jack Rollins and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: A wildly diverse, star-studded trilogy about life in New York. “Life lessons”, directed by Martin Scorsese and starring Nick Nolte and Rosanna Arquette is a passionate tale of a world-famous painter torn between his passion for his art and his infatuation with his unresponsive assistant. “Life without Zoe”, directed by Coppola, stars Talia Shire and Giancarlo Giannini in a whimsical fantasy about childlike parents and a very grown-up daughter. Original music by Carmine Coppola. “Oedipus wrecks” has Woody Allen directing and starring in a comedy about a neurotic lawyer who cannot escape the woman who literally looms largest in his life - his mother. Also stars Mia Farrow, Mae Questal and Julie Kavner.

results.title: Jewel of the Nile (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Lewis Teague, Michael Douglas and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Thrill-packed sequel to “Romancing the Stone”. It’s been six months since Joan Wilder (Kathleen Turner) and Jack Colton (Michael Douglas) sailed into the sunset after their first adventure - but it hasn’t all been smooth sailing. Then they learn of the mysterious, priceless Jewel of the Nile, and it’s non-stop excitement as they race to beat villainous Danny de Vito to the treasure.

results.title: Three fugitives (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Francis Veber, Lauren Shuler and Touchstone Pictures
results.brief_description: Nick Nolte plays a tough ex-con, fresh out of prison, who is trapped in a bank and held hostage by a bungling, first-time holdup man (Martin Short). No one will believe Nolte’s innocence and no one can believe Short’s guilt, so the unlikely duo become partners in crime - and parenting, when Short’s six year old daughter joins the fugitives on a wheel-screeching run for the Canadian border. An American version of the successful French film of the same name.

results.title: Yaaba
results.creator_credit: Idrissa Ouedraogo, Michel David, Freddy Denaes, Pierre-Alain Meier, Arcadia Films, Les Films de L'Avenir and Heima Film
results.brief_description: Few films are as fresh and simple as “Yaaba”, even fewer come as close to perfection. Set in a few flat, sunbaked hectares around a village in Burkina Faso the story is told with the directness of fable with little dialogue, and with the four-square photography confined to three colours - brown, blue and green. The central generation gap story is enriched with incidents of village life so that a vast range of human behaviour and experience is packed in without any sense of haste or padding. The result is not an example of naive cinema but a film whose technical and aesthetic sophistication is presented with an uncloying charm.

results.title: The Picture Show Man
results.creator_credit: John Power, Joan Long and Limelight Productions
results.brief_description: Maurice Pym is a travelling cinema operator in the 1920’s who, with his son Larry and his dapper pianist Freddie, covers the back roads of northern New South Wales. The film follows their adventures and their rivalry with a brash American rival who intrudes into their territory and threatens to steal their livelihood. Based on the memoirs of Lyle Penn, the film nostalgically depicts a past age, and the effect of new technologies on the cinema industry. Cast includes Rod Taylor, John Meillon and Jeanie Drynan.

results.title: The Purple rose of Cairo
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut, Charles H. Joffe and Jack Rollins
results.brief_description: Trapped in a dreary marriage, Cecilia escapes to the cinema and in particular to the romantic adventure “The purple rose of Cairo”. Then one night as she watches the film the hero, Tom Baxter, steps out of the screen and into her life. But where does that leave the other characters - indeed the whole film? The real-life actor who played Tom is in danger of his career being finished, the producers see only lawsuits coming their way. Pandemonium sets in as real life clashes with fantasy. A bitter-sweet comedy starring Mia Farrow, Jeff Daniels and Danny Aiello. Best film 1985 British Academy Awards.

results.title: The Unbearable lightness of being
results.creator_credit: Philip Kaufman, Saul Zaentz and Orion Pictures Corporation
results.brief_description: Tomas is a master of seduction. To him women are for pleasure and Sabina is the ultimate, a free spirit like himself. Life is blissfully simple until Tomas meets the young and innocent Tereza who awakens in him a tenderness he never knew possible. But it is 1968 and as the Russian tanks roll into Prague Tomas is forced to make choices; between love of his country and his yearning for freedom, between desire for Sabina and devotion to the ever-faithful Tereza. Adapted from the novel by Milan Kundera, the film stars Daniel Day-Lewis, Juliette Binoche and Lena Olin.
